alert.note: Alert for Davidson; Forsyth; Guilford (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 26 at 7:52PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A cluster of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Forsyth, north central Davidson and northwestern Guilford Counties through 845 PM EDT... At 751 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking the strong thunderstorm near Pinnacle, or near Pilot Mountain, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph, heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Winston-Salem, Kernersville, Clemmons, Bermuda Run, Huntsville, Lewisville, Stokesdale, Walkertown, Rural Hall and Pfafftown. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
